Name: Statue of the queen Isisnefret
Description: This statue in quartzite represents Isisnefret, Great Royal Wife of Ramesses II. Only the body of the queen, moulded in a light pleated garment, has survived. On the left side of the statue appears Khaemouaset, her second son, accompanied by a column of text mentioning the name of the prince. He wears the sidelock of infancy on his wig and is dressed in a leopard's skin. The inscription of the dorsal pillar contains a hymn to the queen.
